title: Sr. Hardware Engineer - Medical Device
full_description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.Diagnostic testing is a compass, providing information that helps in the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of a range of health conditions.Abbott's life-changing tests and diagnostic tools give you accurate, timely information to better manage your health. We're empowering smarter medical and economic decision making to help transform the way people manage their health at all stages of life. Every day, more than 10 million tests are run on Abbott's diagnostics instruments, providing lab results for millions of people.Our location in San Diego, CA currently has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Hardware Engineer within our Abbott Rapid Diagnostics Infectious Disease business. The Senior Hardware Engineer will be responsible to support the hardware instrument design and the development of elements related to the new point of care instrument platform.The Senior Hardware Engineer will perform high level design and development activities to support instrument design that are included as part of new product definitions for the instrument. This role will be an integral position to help translate customer input to define and develop the next successful product offering. Including design concept, prototyping, components selection, resolution of technical hurdles, and multi-phased qualification of the instrument hardware.WHAT YOU'LL DO Performs system level design of point of care instruments through translation of customer requirements and commercial vision into technological criteria and performance specifications. + Manages the design analysis on components and/or assemblies to develop products that are cost efficient, manufacturable, and reliable. + Investigates and evaluates existing technologies and methodologies for their applications in the point of care instrument setting. + Collaborates among sub-workstreams, proposes designs, conducts evaluation and tests, communicates and documents results. + Communicates with Consumable Designers, and Systems Engineers to assure successful system integration. + Participates in technical activities with outside suppliers and consultants to ensure the delivery of supplies or services needed to meet scheduled timelines. + Provides technical input for FMEAs and determines risk mitigation strategies/designs . + Leads design review; documents and resolves issues. + Pursues opportunities for patents; contribute to patent applications as appropriate. + Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments. Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU'LL BRINGRequired Master of Science degree in Mechanical, Industrial, Bioengineering or Biomedical Engineering field, related fields will also be considered + 8+ years of product focused experience in medical technology field, IVD experience is a plusPreferred Knowledgeable in design of enclosures and interfaces for human factors and ergonomics within the IVD point of care setting + Demonstrated ability to carry out assignments with minimal guidance in an accurate, dependable manner + Systems approach to problem definition, scoping and solving + Demonstrated ability to deliver products in a regulated environment and the phase gate process + Experience collaborating with internal and external partners and contract manufacturers + Ability to analyze, resolve and reconcile ambiguous or conflicting requirements + Knowledge of international standards relevant to the development of an IVD product + Experience with optical systems and components relative to IVD instrumentsWHAT WE OFFERAt Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:Training and career development , with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance + Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans + Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs + Paid time off + 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match + The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communitiesLearn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com (http://www.abbottbenefits.com/pages/candidate.aspx)Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future.
